channel.title: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error
channel.description:
Hello friends!
I get firefox but cant run it. :(

item.title: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error
item.dc:creator: Ego
item.description:
Good day,

@Lana: You seem to have quite a few different issues which may or may not be based on a simple misunderstanding of Whonix and the base it uses. Please read at least the most basic parts of our documentation, as this will probably clear up quite a lot of things.

Furthermore, as mentioned in one of your other threads, the way you formulate questions and tell us the necessary information to help you is rather unhelpful (for example, just posting pictures in a thread with no cohesiveness), so it might be a good idea, if you took a look at this text on proper question asking procedure: http://www.catb.org/esr/faqs/smart-questions.html

Have a nice day,

Ego

Read full topic
item.source: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error

item.title: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Lana:

Linux and allows what we need - standad Linux capabilities.

There are standard Linux capabilities in Whonix. There are no artificial restrictions in Whonix. Explained here:

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/About#Based_on_Debian

Lana:

And what soft into Whonix can I install to solve this problem?

“same as in Debian” (i386, 32 bit, so very common and all fine and what not) as per:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Support#Free_Support_Principle

Read full topic
item.source: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error

item.title: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error
item.dc:creator: Lana
item.description:
And what soft into Whonix can I install to solve this problem?
For example the pseudo-VM that uses the kernel of the Whonix - Linux and allows what we need - standad Linux capabilities.

Read full topic

item.title: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Lana:

And what is Qubes-Whonix?

Please use search engines first then you can find answers to such questions yourself.

Lana:

Here no work standard programs in Whonix?

The simplified answer “anything works”. Please refer to post 3:
cannot execute binary file: Exec format error

Of course Whonix is Linux based so Windows software will not work out of the box and requires…

I use it https://www.whonix.org/wiki/VirtualBox

item.source: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error

item.title: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
My previous post is talking exactly about all of that. You are most likely using 32 bit Non-Qubes-Whonix. (There is no 64 bit version unless you build it yourself from source code.) So you cannot use firefox x86_64. (x86_64 is included in the link that you posted.)

Read full topic
item.source: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error

item.title: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error
item.dc:creator: Lana
item.description:
https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/releases/46.0/linux-x86_64-EME-free/en-US/firefox-46.0.tar.bz2

https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/releases/46.0/linux-x86_64/en-US/firefox-46.0.tar.bz2

https://www.torproject.org/dist/torbrowser/5.5.5/tor-browser-linux32-5.5.5_en-US.tar.xz

Read full topic
item.source: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error

item.title: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I guess you are using 32 bit Non-Qubes-Whonix and installed 64 bit
software. Through an undocumented way.

Generally, use apt-get. Only if there is no alternative and a strong
reason do manually install.

Firefox is called iceweasel in Debian and already installed from Debian
package sources.

But you should not use firefox / icewesel in Whonix anyhow. Use Tor
Browser. Why and documentation:

Whonix

Tor Browser

Using Tor Browser in Whonix. Anonymity vs Pseudonymity, HTTPS Everywhere, Torbutton, Protection against dangerous JavaScript, NoScript, Tips, Update T...

See also:

Whonix

Install Software

Installing additional Software on Whonix. Safety considerations.

Read full topic
